bug.author: yaroslavvb
bug.summary: CLI: Windows with Anaconda prompt ‚Äî W&B process failed to launch
bug.description:
Wandb version: 0.8.1, Python 3.6, Amazon DLAMI 23 environment, local-only mode (no API key set, using local wandb logging) Wandb is crashing with following message: <denchmark-code> ec2-user@ip-172-31-6-116 ~]$ { python nccl_multiversion.py --internal_role=worker --internal_cmd='/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/bin/mpirun -n 16 -N 8 -x FI_PROVIDER="efa" -x FI_OFI_RXR_RX_COPY_UNEXP=1 -x FI_OFI_RXR_RX_COPY_OOO=1 -x FI_EFA_MR_CACHE_ENABLE=1 -x FI_OFI_RXR_INLINE_MR_ENABLE=1 -x LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/ec2-user/nccl/nccl-2.4.6/aws-ofi-nccl/install/lib/:/home/ec2-user/nccl/nccl-2.4.6/nccl/build/lib:/usr/local/cuda-10.0/lib64:/opt/amazon/efa/lib64:/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH -x NCCL_DEBUG=INFO -x NCCL_TREE_THRESHOLD=0 --host 172.31.6.116,172.31.6.125 --mca btl tcp,self --mca btl_tcp_if_exclude lo,docker0 --bind-to none --oversubscribe /home/ec2-user/nccl/nccl-2.4.6/nccl-tests/build/all_reduce_perf -b 8 -e 1024M -f 2 -g 1 -c 1 ' --internal_; } > >(tee -a /tmp/ncluster/0.nccl_multiversion-kyezc/8.out) 2> >(tee -a /tmp/ncluster/0.nccl_multiversion-kyezc/8.out >&2); echo $? > /tmp/ncluster/0.nccl_multiversion-kyezc/8.status wandb: W&B is a tool that helps track and visualize machine learning experiments wandb: No credentials found. Run "wandb login" to visualize your metrics wandb: Started W&B process version 0.8.1 with PID 26257 wandb: ERROR W&B process (PID 26257) did not respond wandb: ERROR Failed to kill wandb process, PID 26257 wandb: ERROR W&B process failed to launch, see: wandb/debug.log Traceback (most recent call last): File "nccl_multiversion.py", line 281, in <module> main() File "nccl_multiversion.py", line 275, in main worker() File "nccl_multiversion.py", line 251, in worker wandb.init(project='nccl_multiversion', name=name) File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 776, in init _init_headless(run, False) File "/home/ec2-user/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 248, in _init_headless "W&B process failed to launch, see: {}".format(path)) wandb.run_manager.LaunchError: W&B process failed to launch, see: wandb/debug.log </denchmark-code>
Here's the debug log <denchmark-code>2019-06-05 15:23:49,504 DEBUG MainThread:2899 [wandb_config.py:_load_defaults():81] no defaults not found in config-defaults.yaml 2019-06-05 15:23:49,513 DEBUG comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.93. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Haven't see this since, will reopen if I see anything that could be used to debug this

I have the same issue with wandb version 0.8.6, python 3.6.9, Amazon DLAMI 23 environment. I've tried create new conda environment and register new W&B account: everything is the same. Here's wandb.debug.log <denchmark-code>2019-08-02 16:07:23,736 DEBUG MainThread:2041 [wandb_config.py:_load_defaults():84] no defaults not found in config-defaults.yaml 2019-08-02 16:07:23,737 DEBUG MainThread:2041 [cmd.py:execute():722] Popen(['git', 'rev-parse', '--show-toplevel'], cwd=/home/ubuntu, universal_newlines=False, shell=None, istream=None) 2019-08-02 16:07:23,741 DEBUG MainThread:2041 [cmd.py:execute():722] Popen(['git', 'rev-parse', '--show-toplevel'], cwd=/home/ubuntu, universal_newlines=False, shell=None, istream=None) 2019-08-02 16:07:23,771 DEBUG MainThread:2041 [cmd.py:execute():722] Popen(['git', 'cat-file', '--batch-check'], cwd=/home/ubuntu, universal_newlines=False, shell=None, istream=<valid stream>) 2019-08-02 16:07:23,784 DEBUG MainThread:2041 [cmd.py:execute():722] Popen(['git', 'rev-parse', '--show-toplevel'], cwd=/home/ubuntu, universal_newlines=False, shell=None, istream=None) 2019-08-02 16:07:23,788 DEBUG MainThread:2041 [cmd.py:execute():722] Popen(['git', 'status', '--porcelain', '--untracked-files'], cwd=/home/ubuntu, universal_newlines=False, shell=None, istream=None) </denchmark-code>
Are you seeing a stacktrace in your terminal? It looks like your process is dieing after 4 seconds.

FYI I am consistently seeing the same error in a distributed setting whenever I'm trying to set the id like this: <denchmark-code>wandb.init(project="test", job_type='master' if rank == 0 else 'worker', group=args.experiment_name, config=args, id=args.run_name ) </denchmark-code>
If I comment out the id=args.run_name, it works fine but then there's a separate id for each process. I'm running this on a (custom) docker container in Azure ML, so not easy to debug unfortunately...

The id you set has to be unique across a given project. If you just want to change the display name you can set name=args.run_name <denchmark-link:#>‚Ä¶</denchmark-link>
On Tue, Aug 13, 2019 at 5:14 AM Heikki Arponen ***@***.***> wrote: FYI I am consistently seeing the same error in a distributed setting whenever I'm trying to set the id like this:
wandb.init(project="test", job_type='master' if rank == 0 else 'worker', group=args.experiment_name, config=args, id=args.run_name )
If I comment out the id=args.run_name, it works fine but then there's a separate id for each process. I'm running this on a (custom) docker container in Azure ML, so not easy to debug unfortunately...
‚Äî You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#366?email_source=notifications&email_token=AAAAAEKQPWFEKPEEMEMYQZ3QEKQTLA5CNFSM4HVYQLIKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOD4FO2KI#issuecomment-520809769>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAAAAELJTFGQZFQZR54DEA3QEKQTLANCNFSM4HVYQLIA> .
yeah I know, I'm using a unique id... I don't think the errors are related to that?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/harpone>@harpone</denchmark-link> That init call looks like you are reusing id between workers (typically need to incorporate $RANK to make it unique). IMHO it's better to not touch the ID and instead only set run_name (logging from chief process only) or group_name (logging from all processes) . For the case of latter, you need to make group_name unique between reruns or wandb display will merge them. Here's how I'm setting it <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cybertronai/imagenet18/blob/218ef7e63894c8a107eb764f27d7cd27309e960d/training/train_imagenet_nv.py#L110>https://github.com/cybertronai/imagenet18/blob/218ef7e63894c8a107eb764f27d7cd27309e960d/training/train_imagenet_nv.py#L110</denchmark-link>
Ah OK thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yaroslavvb>@yaroslavvb</denchmark-link> , that clears it up a lot!

I am also getting the same error. It seems random, most of my jobs work well. Others fails with timeouts. My debug log is 26mb unfortunately and can't find anything informative in there. <denchmark-code>wandb: Tracking run with wandb version 0.8.21 wandb: Run data is saved locally in ../../experiments/wandb/wave_propagation/wandb/run-20200121_205449-icfw2hdx wandb: Syncing run unet_batch_16_samples_5_in_10_out_1_horizon_20_normalizer_normal_lr_0.0001_dataset_original_patience_7_wd_0_time_24 wandb: ‚≠êÔ∏è View project at https://app.wandb.ai/stathius/wave_prop wandb: üöÄ View run at https://app.wandb.ai/stathius/wave_prop/runs/icfw2hdx wandb: Run `wandb off` to turn off syncing. wandb: ERROR W&B process (PID 17606) did not respond wandb: ERROR W&B process failed to launch, see: /rds/general/user/ef1015/home/experiments/wandb/wave_propagation/wandb/debug.log Traceback (most recent call last): File "train_network.py", line 18, in <module> wandb.init(project=args.project, name=args.experiment_name, config=vars(args)) File "/rds/general/user/ef1015/home/anaconda3/envs/cuda10/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 1075, in init _init_headless(run) File "/rds/general/user/ef1015/home/anaconda3/envs/cuda10/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 296, in _init_headless "W&B process failed to launch, see: {}".format(path)) wandb.run_manager.LaunchError: W&B process failed to launch, see: /rds/general/user/ef1015/home/experiments/wandb/wave_propagation/wandb/debug.log </denchmark-code>
I'm getting this error now. Any updates?

Are you using 0.8.25? We put a fix in that version. But there still could be a problem depending on your environment. what Os/environment? Windows? Jupyter notebook? Can you paste the full error message and a few lines before and after. Also the wandb/debug.log could be useful. If you want to email it, I'm at: jeff (at) wandb (dot) com Thanks.
For me it was the connection issue. Thanks
Experienced this issue w/ wandb==0.8.13 (was running seven experiments on GCP), fixed after upgrading to version 0.8.25.

I'm facing the same issue on version 0.8.35. EDIT: This issue is still there in version 0.8.36 WandB works fine in jupyter. But I get this error message when I am running the same program in anaconda powershell and anaconda prompt (My OS is Windows-10) with the same virtual environment where jupyter was working. For anyone hitting this error on windows. Try our new Windows optimized version at: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wandb/client-ng>https://github.com/wandb/client-ng</denchmark-link> You can use it by running
Oh!! thanks a lot, it works now after installing this version and without changing anything in my code. Thanks!

For anyone hitting this error on windows. Try our new Windows optimized version at: https://github.com/wandb/client-ng You can use it by running pip install wandb-ng
I was having the same issue with code that ran perfectly on Google Colab and Mac, but failed on Windows. Chris's suggestion fixed it for me. However, this version of wandb complains when specifying save dir location, or resuming parameter: [WARNING] currently unsupported wandb.init() arg: dir [WARNING] currently unsupported wandb.init() arg: resume I can live without the latter, but the former is a more significant downgrade from the main wandb module. Not being able to specify a custom save location is very disruptive.
